column4: there are too many resources to give, for that wide question. Many of them not ubuntu specific in any way. Can you rephrase your question?

I'm not sure there is more to it from Linux DHCP point of view than having CONFIG_VLAN_8021Q on and having the DHCP server in all the networks (and preferably firewalling some to keep the networks apart). see http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/7268
I hope it helps. Out of curiousity, how large a network are you dealing with, there?
